action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Louisiana introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to study the suitability and feasibility of re-establishing the New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park Study Act of 2022.

paragraph.text: The term Park means the New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.
The term study area means the study area described in section 3(b).

subsection.text: The Secretary, in consultation with State historic preservation officers, State historical societies, State tourism offices, and other appropriate organizations or agencies, shall conduct a study to assess the suitability and feasibility of designating the study area as the New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park.
The study area shall include the portion of the New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park and surrounding areas that are comprised of the following:
The study shall include analysis, documentation, and determinations on whether the study area—

paragraph.text: has an assemblage of natural, historic, and cultural resources that—

subparagraph.text: represent distinctive aspects of the heritage of the United States;
are worthy of recognition, conservation, interpretation, and continuing use; and

clause.text: through partnerships among public and private entities; and
by linking diverse and sometimes noncontiguous resources and active communities;

paragraph.text: reflects traditions, customs, beliefs, and folklife that are a valuable part of the story of the United States;

subparagraph.text: outstanding opportunities to conserve natural, historic, cultural, or scenic features; and
are important to any identified themes of the study area; and
retain a degree of integrity capable of supporting interpretation;

paragraph.text: includes residents, business interests, nonprofit organizations, and State and local governments that—

subparagraph.text: are involved in the planning of the Park;
have developed a conceptual financial plan that outlines the roles of all participants in the Park, including the Federal Government; and
have demonstrated support for the designation of the Park;

paragraph.text: has a potential management entity to work in partnership with the individuals and entities described in paragraph (5) to develop the Park while encouraging State and local economic activity; and
has a conceptual boundary map that is supported by the public.

section.text: Not later than the 3d fiscal year after the date on which funds are first made available to carry out this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate a report that describes—

paragraph.text: the findings of the study; and
any conclusions and recommendations of the Secretary.
